verses.text: The king's heart \add is\add* in the hand of the LORD, \add as\add* the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
Every way of a man \add is\add* right in his own eyes: but the LORD pondereth the hearts.
To do justice and judgment \add is\add* more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
A high look, and a proud heart, \add and\add* the plowing of the wicked, \add is\add* sin.
The thoughts of the diligent \add tend\add* only to plenteousness; but of every one \add that is\add* hasty only to want.
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue \add is\add* a vanity tossed to and fro by them that seek death.
The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.
The way of man \add is\add* froward and strange: but \add as for\add* the pure, his work \add is\add* right.
\add It is\add* better to dwell in a corner of the house-top, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbor findeth no favor in his eyes.
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
The righteous \add man\add* wisely considereth the house of the wicked: \add but God\add* overthroweth the wicked for \add their\add* wickedness.
Whoever stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom, strong wrath.
\add It is\add* joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction \add shall be\add* to the workers of iniquity.
The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
He that loveth pleasure \add shall be\add* a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
The wicked \add shall be\add* a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
\add It is\add* better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.
\add There is\add* a treasure to be desired, and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honor.
A wise \add man\add* scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of its confidence.
Whoever keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
Proud \add and\add* haughty scorner \add is\add* his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labor.
He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
The sacrifice of the wicked \add is\add* abomination: how much more, \add when\add* he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
A wicked man hardeneth his face: but \add as for\add* the upright, he directeth his way.
\add There is\add* no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
The horse \add is\add* prepared against the day of battle: but safety \add is\add* from the LORD.
